overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). It focuses on daily seasonality detection, acknowledges data constraints, and selects a practical averaging method after evaluating alternatives. The analysis shows careful consideration of patterns, potential weekly effects, and rounding precision, though constrained by the small dataset.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
Potential weekly pattern (unverifiable due to limited data)
key_insights: Averaging same-hour values across days smooths noise and captures daily patterns
Limited data (4 days) restricts complex models like SARIMA and weekly seasonality analysis
Rounding forecasts to 3 decimals using round-half-to-even for consistency with input data
Explicit handling of date/time alignment for forecast periods
Trade-off between model complexity and data availability drives method selection
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines pattern recognition, method evaluation, and practical implementation, but avoids advanced statistical models due to data limitations.
